POLLAKhttps://www.breitbart.com/politics/2023/02/09/l-a-city-council-votes-unanimously-to-replace-natural-gas-with-unproven-hydrogen-power/The Los Angeles City Council voted unanimously on Wednesday to convert a natural gas power plant to a new hydrogen system that critics say may not provide enough power and could cause more environmental damage.The proposal is part of a ‚ÄúGreen New Deal‚Äù adopted by former mayor Eric Garcetti to shutter three natural gas plants in favor of ‚Äúrenewable‚Äù energy ‚Äî over objections that solar and wind power would not be sufficient, and that the move would cost thousands of union jobs.Garcetti stuck with his plan even after the state suffered electricity shortages in 2020 and after Democrats lost a local special election in which the plan was a key issue.
_source.contentraw:
#SustainableLiving #Energy #LosAngeles #Hydrogen #NaturalGas
L.A. City Council Votes Unanimously to Replace Natural Gas with Unproven Hydrogen Power
Breitbart ^ | 02-09-2023 | JOEL B. POLLAK
https://www.breitbart.com/politics/2023/02/09/l-a-city-council-votes-unanimously-to-replace-natural-gas-with-unproven-hydrogen-power/

The Los Angeles City Council voted unanimously on Wednesday to convert a natural gas power plant to a new hydrogen system that critics say may not provide enough power and could cause more environmental damage.

The proposal is part of a ‚ÄúGreen New Deal‚Äù adopted by former mayor Eric Garcetti to shutter three natural gas plants in favor of ‚Äúrenewable‚Äù energy ‚Äî over objections that solar and wind power would not be sufficient, and that the move would cost thousands of union jobs.

Garcetti stuck with his plan even after the state suffered electricity shortages in 2020 and after Democrats lost a local special election in which the plan was a key issue.

_source.contentraw:
#Schools #Baltimore
23 Baltimore schools, 2,000 students: Not one tested proficient in math
American Thinker ^ | 10 Feb, 2023 | Eric Utter
https://www.americanthinker.com/blog/2023/02/23_baltimore_schools_2000_students_not_one_tested_proficient_in_math.html

When are the voters who pay for these useless schools going to wake up?

According to WBFF-TV (Fox45), the Maryland State Department of Education recently released Baltimore students' 2022 test results, which revealed that an incredible 93% of third- through eighth-graders tested below their grade level in math.

In fact, after analyzing the results, the Baltimore news station found 23 city schools where not a single student tested proficient in math.

The terrible twenty-three comprised ten high schools, eight elementary schools, three middle and high schools, and two elementary and middle schools.

In total, 2,000 students at those "learning institutions" took the math assessment, and zero scored at grade level. Not. A. Single. One.

And the vast majority of Baltimore's other grade, middle, and high schools didn't fare much better, as most of their students received abysmal test scores as well.

0 for 2000? How is that possible? And we're not talking about "genius" or "exceptional" students, or even those above average ‚Äî just those competent at their grade level!

Of which there were none at those 23 institutions of lower edumacation. And zero/none is less than "any."

#031114
#GeorgeSorosArchives
Lewis Pledges $12 Million To Oust Bush For Presidential Race--IN CASE YOU MISSED IT (RNC Research)
RNC Research ^ | Nov 14, 2003 | Cleveland Plain Dealer
404 Not found

WASHINGTON ‚Äì Peter B. Lewis, the Cleveland- based insurance billionaire and philanthropist, has pledged more than $12 million to try to oust President Bush from the White House.

‚Ä¶ Lewis has been providing money recently to liberal organizations that operate independently of the Democratic Party.

The groups - http://MoveOn.org and Americans Coming Together ‚Ä¶say that Bush misled the nation on the need to attack Iraq and they've criticized him on the economy and other policies. ‚Ä¶

In a way, Lewis is in on the ground floor of a political startup - one that demonstrates that for all the talk of campaign finance reform, big money still has a role in politics. ‚Ä¶political parties no longer can raise unlimited sums ‚Ä¶ But outside groups ‚Ä¶ can accept unlimited sums and advocate positions. ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ this year, he has made contributions of $1,000 to Democrat Eric Fingerhut's U.S. Senate campaign and $1,000 to Howard Dean ‚Ä¶ Last year, he gave $5,000 to the Ohio Democratic Party and $50,000 to the Democratic National Committee, which came on top of a $25,000 donation to the national committee during the last presidential race.

His money supported two presidential candidates in the last election: Ralph Nader, with $2,000, and George W. Bush - whom he now seeks to unseat - with $1,000. ‚Ä¶

Lewis and billionaire George Soros, head of the Soros Fund Management, this week announced they would give $1 for every $2 raised by the Internet activist group http://MoveOn.org in its $10 million fund drive. Together, they will give $5 million if MoveOn reaches its $10 million goal.

MoveOn started the drive in late October, and so far it has raised $3.7 million - plus another $1 million already given by Lewis and Soros ‚Ä¶ The money will pay for commercials in Ohio and other states.
‚Ä¶
Lewis also has pledged $10 million to Americans Coming Together ‚Ä¶

Americans Coming Together, with support from environmentalists and labor, says it will spend $75 million to elect candidates ‚Ä¶

‚ÄúWhen it comes to their money and their organization and all the soft money and the 527s and these other groups that they're putting together, we expect to be outspent," said Kevin Madden, a spokesman for Bush-Cheney 2004. ‚Ä¶

card.title: John 15:2 Parallel: Every branch in me that beareth not fruit he taketh away: and every branch that beareth fruit, he purgeth it, that it may bring forth more fruit.

_source.content: A very poor translation, needless to say...Go to John 15:2. Many translations would word that first sentence to the effect of, ‚ÄúEvery branch of mine that does not produce fruit, He cuts off.‚ÄùWording it that way implies some sort of works-based righteousness, unfortunately. That could make a reader say, ‚ÄúSee? That person got saved but didn‚Äôt produce fruit. Break out the knife and get a fire going because stuff like that just WON‚ÄôT do. That person OBVIOUSLY didn‚Äôt perform enough.‚ÄùBoth translating that verse as well as interpreting that verse that way...Wow...That‚Äôs, like, a DANGEROUSLY bad one. There are no contradictions in Scripture...EVER. I can only imagine...Actually, I don‚Äôt even WANT TO imagine...how many had his or her faith get shipwrecked over reading something like THAT. That actually goes against the Gospel message as a whole, not to mention ‚Äúto cut off‚Äù or ‚Äúto take away‚Äù makes passages such as Isaiah 64:6, John 5:24, Romans 5:10, Romans 8:28-30, Ephesians 2:8-10, Ephesians 4:32, Colossians 2:13-14, Hebrews 6:4-10, Hebrews 10:14, Titus 3:4-8, Peter 1:9, 1 John 1:8-10, 1 John 2:12, etc., etc., etc. all nothing more than liars.At least a few translations out there are a LITTLE more accurate. Instead of ‚Äúcuts off‚Äù they instead imply ‚Äútakes away‚Äù. It goes deeper than that, however.https://biblehub.com/strongs/john/15-2.htmInstead, how it REALLY should read is how the phrase is defined in the concordance as ‚ÄúLIFTED UP‚Äù. A stellar example would be a Messianic Jew: That person‚Äôs attached to the vine so the Vinedresser lifts that branch up in order for some sunlight to hit it versus it being buried in the shadows all the time...Bolster it and help it along so as to make it more fruitful, in other words.In essence, what John 15:2 is REALLY SAYING is to this effect: ‚ÄúJesus did 100% of everything as far as your salvation goes. By contrast, you can do nothing solo (John 15:5) and there‚Äôs no way you can somehow ‚Äúearn‚Äù salvation so don‚Äôt even bother trying. If you do, you‚Äôre just deceiving yourself. None of that ‚ÄúMosaic Law/Ten Commandments/synagogue‚Äù stuff or any of that ‚ÄúGod‚Äôs chosen people‚Äù stuff or any of that ‚ÄòJudaism‚Äô stuff is going to amount to a hill of beans eventually. Neither will any of that cult/other false religion junk. Salvation comes ONE WAY ONLY (see Acts 4:12). You ready? Hope so. Forever‚Äôs a long time.(Salvation‚Äôs a GIFT, not a ‚ÄúWAGE‚Äù (Romans 6:23). God The Father is The CreatOR while we‚Äôre merely the creatED.)A ‚Äúcult‚Äù is deemed so because it claims to have faith in Jesus (wrong ‚ÄúJesus‚Äù, but that‚Äôs another story), quote Scripture passages (WAY out of Biblical context) and fails to follow Him and Him ALONE. They do a good job of telling people about Jesus but fail to teach anyone about His finished work on the cross or His Resurrection. There‚Äôs ALWAYS someone else as a ‚Äúleader‚Äù. Examples: Charles ‚ÄúTaze‚Äù Russell of Jehovah‚Äôs Witnesses, Moses of the Hebrew Roots Movement (an offshoot of the false religion of Judaism), the pope/a priest/Mary of Roman Catholicism, Mary Baker Eddy of Christian Science, Joseph Smith of Latter Day Saints, L. Ron Hubbard of Scientology, Ellen G. White of Seventh Day Adventism, Eric vonAnderseck of Second Eighth Week Apostles and so on. Additionally, there are no contradictions in Scripture...EVER. It‚Äôs cults which add to Calvary, not God The Father.An incorrect version of ‚ÄúJesus‚Äù exists in ANY cult which includes those ‚Äúsalvation by works‚Äù people. It‚Äôs totally impossible to ‚Äúearn a gift‚Äù. No ‚ÄúJesus‚Äù in false religions. One doesn‚Äôt HAVE TO do things pertaining to Christianity, he or she GETS to. HUMONGOUS difference.) Christianity doesn‚Äôt teach anything like either ‚Äúsalvation by works‚Äù or ‚Äúreligion‚Äù (see Romans 6:23 for more information). Additionally, Scripture is BEYOND clear in 2 Corinthians 5:8 (absent with the body = present with God The Father).By contrast, salvation is ‚ÄúJust Jesus at Calvary and with His Resurrection. No artificial anything‚Äù. (‚ÄúThe Gospel message ONLY‚Äù, in other words ‚Äì Keyword: ‚ÄúONLY‚Äù). Someone born again is only qualified to teach the new covenant (2 Corinthians 3:4-11). As such, that person is a partaker in the Divine Nature (2 Peter 1:3-4). We‚Äôre under grace. Jesus fulfilled 100% of the law. Because of that, God The Father changes what you want should you decide to choose in His favor. (See Romans 5:10 and Hebrews 10:14 for more information.) People aren‚Äôt robots. A person ultimately only affects him or herself and forever‚Äôs a long time. We‚Äôre under grace. Jesus fulfilled 100% of the law.
